description: two-phase competition.  The pre-qualification list will be terminated upon award of contract.  Conditional Set-Aside under the Federal Government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB)
full_summary:
### Invitation for Qualification - Harbour Improvements at Poplar River, Manitoba
#### Reference: cb-952-58195107; Solicitation Number: 30004983
A two-phase selection process will be used for the procurement of Harbour Improvements at Poplar River, Manitoba. This Invitation to Qualify represents the first phase.

**Contract Description:**
The contractor will be responsible for the construction of a new timber anchor wharf, two new timber floating wharves, and various harbour repairs. These repairs include timber fender installation, rubber fender installation, timber curbing installation, and harbour sign installation.

**Conditional Set-Aside:**
This tender is subject to a conditional set-aside for Indigenous businesses under the Federal Government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB). In Phase 2, the bidder must demonstrate their registration as an Indigenous Business in the Indigenous Business Registry.

**Qualification Criteria:**
Only bidders who meet all qualification requirements will be invited to proceed to the next phase. The following criteria will be used to evaluate bidders:

* Business registration (provincial or territorial)
* Past performance in similar projects
* Relevant experience in construction and maritime projects
* Financial stability and resources

**Important Dates:**

* Tender Closing Date: October 19, 2023, at 14:02:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: December 1, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: March 15, 2024

**Contact Information:**

* Dina Al-Eryani, Contract Authority
* Email: [Dina.Al-Eryani@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:Dina.Al-Eryani@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
* Phone: 506-282-2340

**Attachment:**

* Recipeint feedback letter if you did not meet the criteria and A RESPOND project flier that explains the key elements of navigation at Poplar River to inform outlines for sailing times.

Note to the writer: The original document is in a .conf  format which is typically used by Canadian Government contracting platforms. The Contractor has shared a number of the key elements with you which you will incorporate into your output above. Rewrite the entry, as I described above, into a more readable and professional format. 2024
**Success:**
